alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:16PM MST until January 16 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Strong winds and blowing snow producing localized ground blizzards along highway 93, between Golden and Boulder. Also, Interstate 70 west of Denver into the foothills, as well as C-470. Peak wind gusts from 50 to 65 mph. * WHERE...The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Roads, in particular highway 93 from Denver to Golden, will be slick and hazardous in spots due to blowing snow. Blowing snow will suddenly reduce visibility to 100 ft or less.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling or consider an alternate route. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Areas of blowing snow is expected to make travel very difficult.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
